channel.title: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
channel.description:
When I bought my external HD a few months ago (this story isn't related to the other topic about an external HD), I didn't bother formatting it (idiot +1) so it used fat32. I found out that Iso's were too large for it, but I already had quite a collection of audio and video on the HD so I decided to put Iso's on my internal HD. But a few days ago, my internal started to get full, so I downloaded Parted Magic and used it to make my fat32 partition smaller, and create a new partition and format it in ntfs. All went well, so I moved most of my files (the 1TB disk was filled more than 50%) to my new partition. No problem there.
So yesterday I decided that I wanted one partition (idiot++). So I made my fat32 partition even smaller, and wanted to add the unallocated space to the ntfs partition. A feasible plan. Gparted states that it takes 4 hours to read the data, which is fine. But when the 4 hours were over, it needed another 7-8 hours to write. I didn't want to wait that long, so I made my master move: I cancelled the write procedure (idiot + ∞).
When I rebooted Windows, it asked to test the consistency of the disk. It checked it, it fixed a few things and booted. Now, the data is still there. Even the meta-data of every single song is fine. But nothing works anymore. I can't watch the movies, can't listen to my music.
Are there any methods to fix the data, or is everything lost?

item.title: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

sppt:

Can you still access the data from linux, btw?

I haven’t tried yet, but I guess I can. I can access all the data via Windows, I can open them but for instance an mp3 starts to play and stops immediately after, without actually playing a single note. .txt files are made up of Asian characters.

ownagesbot: I’ll try it, but isn’t there something similar in Parted Magic?

Read full topic
item.source: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?

item.title: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

I think the one I used was ‘Recover My Files’

Read full topic
item.source: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?

item.title: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Kinda sounds like your MFT is either corrupted, with the indexes pointing at the wrong place, or it’s corrupted in a way that it still points to the data, but the data is gone.
In any case, do what ownagesbot said above, I suppose it wouldn’t hurt.
Can you still access the data from linux, btw?

Read full topic
item.source: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?

item.title: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

google some recovery programs, there are a few and provided u dont write over the data you can get most of it back

Read full topic
item.source: Explain to me how much of an idiot I am?
